claim: A dashboard/control-plane API should be additive-only within the v1 surface: new fields may be added, but existing fields must not be removed or change type.
Control plane server should be local-first: bind to 127.0.0.1 by default and require a bearer token for all endpoints.
Worker identity must not be repo name; workerId must remain stable for concurrency/UI.
Single daemon per queue is required until claim semantics are transactional.
OpenCode server instances must not be shared across different worktrees; default is one server per active worktree.
The parent verification agent emits a last-line marker `RALPH_PARENT_VERIFY: {"version":1,...}`.
Escalation marker parsing is deterministic and machine-parseable.
SQLite under `~/.ralph` stores durable internal state (sessions, worktrees, cursors, run records).

Ralph escalates only when it cannot safely proceed without human intervention. Escalation sensitivity is driven only by `ralph:*` labels plus deterministic markers and contract-surface detection; ignore non-`ralph:*` labels.
For concurrent work, Ralph may isolate mutable tool caches per repo/task (for example: set a per-worktree `XDG_CACHE_HOME`) to avoid cross-task cache contamination and concurrency hazards.

Marker precedence: (1) `NO PRODUCT GAP:` negates product-gap assertions even if `PRODUCT GAP:` appears elsewhere; (2) if a product-gap marker is present, it overrides routing JSON and forces escalation.
Escalation resolution: operator replies normally, then applies `ralph:cmd:queue` to resume.
Low confidence alone must not trigger escalation for routine tasks.
